DOC.brief_title: Metformin Patients With Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease ( NAFLD )
DOC.detailed_description: Study population : 30 patient included meet follow criterion : ALT > 2 time normal range ; liver histology reveal NASH ( type 2-4 ) , without cirrhosis ; clinical characteristic metabolic syndrome define NCEP , overt diabetes ; negative work-up cause liver disease include alcohol intake < 40 g/week . All patient undergo liver biopsy patient type 2-4 ( steatosis + inflammation , steatosis plus ballooning degeneration , steatosis plus fibrosis and/or Mallory body ) without cirrhosis include . Patients receive lipid lower medication anti hypertensive drug prior study continue treatment . Patients develop overt type 2 DM HbAic > 7 % study withdrawn . Intervention : All patient dietary intervention dietician encourage increase physical activity . Patients receive metformin 850 mg tid 12 month . Outcome : - Improvement liver enzyme ( ALT , AST , GGT ) - Improvement metabolic profile : lipid profile , fast post-load glucose insulin level , HOMA . - Liver histology ( repeat liver biopsy 1 year ) . - Soluble TNF receptors- TNF-receptor P55 P75 .
